greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = A055938(n+1) XOR A055938(n).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..8191
mathematica: Function[t, BitXor @@ # & /@ Transpose@ {Rest@ t, Most@ t}]@ Complement[Range@ Last@ #, #] &@ Table[IntegerExponent[(2 n)!, 2], {n, 0, 112}] (* _Michael De Vlieger_, Mar 15 2017, after _Jean-François Alcover_ at A055938 *)
program: (Scheme) (define (A279353 n) (A003987bi (A055938 (+ 1 n)) (A055938 n))) ;; Here A003987bi implements a bitwise-XOR (A003987).
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Mar 15 2017
